intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: We're finally here. Izumo.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It's beautiful. I had no idea...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Yes. Some call this place the kingdom of the gods. Even when other kingdom are at war. Izumo has remained neutral. It almost seems...too good to be true.

intro.speaker: Izumite
intro.line: Who's there?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ho! Visitors from Hoshido. We seek information about two of our friends who may have passed this way.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Will you please give us permission to enter your territory?

intro.speaker: Izumite
intro.line: Ah, Lady Azura. Of course. People from the kingdom of Hoshido are always welcome within our borders. I'll notify the palace, and someone will be with you shortly.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Thank you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Excuse me, before you go... We're looking for Lord Ryoma and Lord Takumi. We believe they were involved in a battle near your borders. Do you have any information about them?

intro.speaker: Izumite
intro.line: A battle...around here? No, I don't think so.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Really? Nothing?

intro.speaker: Izumite
intro.line: Sir/Milady, Izumo has been a neutral territory for many generations. There's simply no way a battle could have been staged around here. Ah, it seems we're ready to welcome you. Please, come this way.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Very well.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well, I'm no quite sure what we're supposed to do now. Just wait around until someone arrives?

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Yes. This is probably just a bit of formal grandstanding. I've heard that Archduke Izana likes to make people wait a few m-minutes.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well, as long as he eventually shows up with some answers for us...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Wow, is that the archduke? He looks so...serene!

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: I've never met him, but I think it must be. And you're right about his looks. He's almost oddly calm...

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: This is actually making me nervous...

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: Welcome.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Lord? Archduke Izana? May I call you Lord?

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: Bwahaha! Please, call me anything you like. Welcome, welcome! Can I get you anything fizzy or bubbly? Or anything wibbly or wobbly? Heehee!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Um...

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: He's a little different than I expected...

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: Oh, pardon me, I didn't even introduce myself. I'm Archduke Izana! Voted best hair in Izumo five years running! I'm so happy to have some visitors from Hoshido. Now, what kind of weird stuff do y'all like to get into back in the homeland? No, never mind, we'll get into all that later. Let's just sit back and relax and put on some slippers for now, right? Am I right?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Um, yes. You're right. Than you.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Archduke, before we get to the slippers, we have some important questions for you. Are you aware of a recent battle between Hoshido and Nohr in this area?

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: A recent battle? Ha! Not likely! And I'd be the first one to know about it. You know, 'cause I'm the archduke. Giddyup! Haha!

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I see.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Maybe we're in the wrong place...

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: Now hold on just a minute, partner. You're in the rightest place of all. Izana's house! But now that you mentioned a battle, I do see that some of you are wounded. Gosh, we can't have that, can we? Not with all the resources I have here. Guys, we've got some great healers and doctors in my kingdom.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Yes, I've heard about the healers here. They're supposed to be the best.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Excellent. We certainly could use a little bit of rejuvenation. Of course, we can't stay long, but it seems wise to heal our wounds while we can.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Perhaps...

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: Well, I won't take no for an answer. Let's get started with treatments right away! Come on, everyone, let's head over to the spa.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Thank you, Archduke.

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: Ooh, what do we have here? You look pretty banged up, little lady! And your friend—Corrin, was it? Well, you're looking a bit frazzled as well. Tell you what. I've got something special in mind for the two of you. Deep restorative healing is what I call it. It mends the body and soothes the mind. Whaddaya say?

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Just the two of us?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'm not sure we're the only ones with significant wounds... But perhaps we should just play along.

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: Come on, guys! The hot towels won't stay hot forever!

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: Hmm...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It's pretty dark in here. I guess that must help with relaxation. I wonder what all of these sharp-looking devices are for...

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: Welcome.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Archduke, are we in the right place? This is the deep-relaxation chamber?

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: Oh yes. You will go to sleep literally forever in this room. It's our execution chamber! Heehee!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Wait a minute!

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Corrin, we're surrounded!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What are you playing at, Izana? This is not funny.

intro.speaker: Izana
intro.line: Well, we haven't even reached the punchline yet. I'm not Izana. Boom.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Eeheehee! It's been a while, hasn't it, young Corrin? Or don't you remember me? I'm Zola! Dark mage of Nohr.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Am I supposed to be impressed? I don't care who you are. All I care about is what you've done with Izana.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: What? Why would you care about that creep? I'm the one who's finally captured the famous Corrin! I'm the one who matters! Anyway, good luck getting yourself and Princess Sakura out of THIS! Heehee!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: All right...stay behind me, Sakura.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: What are you going to do? There are too many of them...

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Prepare to die!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Here we go...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What's going on? Are they attacking each other?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: No! Idiots! What are you doing?

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: This is some healing treatment our hosts have arranged for us, eh?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Hinoka! How did you know?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: This can't be happening...

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Very impressive, Lady Hinoka. You were right on all counts.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I, too, had my doubts about this situation. Thank you for acting on your instincts, Hinoka.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: I'm so glad you guys are here.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: How in the world did you suspect anything? My Izana disguise as perfect! No matter. I still have enough power to defeat you. The joke is still on you!

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: Your supposed archduke acted a buffoon. No royalty would behave like that.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Precisely.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: How dare you! My impression was flawless. Move forth, men. Take them out!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Get ready, everyone. We've still got a fight on our hands.

battle.speaker: Hinata
battle.line: What's going on here? I thought we were in Izumo! I guess that whole "neutral kingdom" thing isn't working out for 'em anymore. Anyway...do you see Lord Takumi anywhere? I didn't get much info out of those Nohrian soldiers.

battle.speaker: Oboro
battle.line: Perhaps that's because you tied them up and gagged them before questioning them!

battle.speaker: Hinata
battle.line: Bah. You would have done the same thing, and you know it. I'll tie up as many people as I need to track down Lord Takumi.

battle.speaker: Oboro
battle.line: Whatever. I just wish you were the one missing. Then it would just be me and Lord Takumi relaxing in an Izumo sauna...

battle.speaker: Hinata
battle.line: Ugh! Keep it to yourself! Anyway, we've got some work to do. Maybe these guys can lead us to Lord Takumi.

battle.speaker: Oboro
battle.line: You're right. I can't stand these Nohrian scum. If they've done ANYTHING to harm our master...I don't know what I'll do.

battle.speaker: Hinata
battle.line: OK, OK, get a hold of yourself. If you kill all of them on a bloody rampage, then where will we be?

battle.speaker: Oboro
battle.line: You're right. I will decimate them with calculated efficiency...but spare a few. Let's go!

recruit-talk.speaker: Oboro
recruit-talk.line: Wait...who are you? You seem familiar.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: I'm Corrin. And who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Oboro
recruit-talk.line: Oh! Lord Takumi's brother/sister! It's nice to finally meet you. I'm Oboro, Lord Takumi's retainer. Have...have you seen him? We can't find him anywhere!

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: No. But we're hopeful that he's not far from here. We could use your assistance tracking him. Will you join us? I only ask that you...temper your zeal for killing Nohrian moderately.

recruit-talk.speaker: Oboro
recruit-talk.line: Yes, of course. It's just...every time I see one of those evil jerks... I just...start to rage! GRRRRRR! But, if I keep my thoughts focused on my dear Takumi. I can control myself. I'll do my best to assist you, Lord/Lady Corrin.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Thank you, Oboro, good to have you with us.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: You're not with Zola. Whose side are you on?

recruit-talk.speaker: Hinata
recruit-talk.line: Lord/Lady Corrin! You don't know who I am?

recruit-talk.speaker: Hinata
recruit-talk.line: Ha! Probably. The name’s Hinata. I'm Lord Takumi's retainer. Unfortunately, we became separated on the battlefield. We're doing everything we can to track him down, but we're running out of ideas. Will you help us find him?

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Yes, of course. That's why we're all here, too. It looks like we must be on the right track. since we've all arrived at the same location.

recruit-talk.speaker: Hinata
recruit-talk.line: Thank you, Lord/Lady Corrin. It's big of you to put aside your differences and help us find Takumi. Especially after some of the things he's been saying...

boss.speaker: Zola
boss.line: Ah, I see you're ready to die. I'm going to enjoy this!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Game over, Zola. Now tell us where you're keeping Izana!

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: *cough* *cough* Urk... No...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What do you mean, no? You're beaten!

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Oh my. How naive you are. What a sheltered life you've lived! I'd rather die than give you ANYTHING. Luckily, I won't have to. PAH!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: *cough* *cough* He's using some kind of a smoke screen!

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Bingo! Until next time, fools!

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: GYAAAH! Ow, ow, ow... What are you doing? Let me go!

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: No.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo! What are you doing here?

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Ah, Zola. You've embarrassed our kingdom for the last time.

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Milord! Please, you don't mean that... I was just attempting to preserve my dignity.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Dignity? What would you know about that? You're done here.

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Gyaaaah! Nooo...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo, what are you going to do?

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Zola is a monster. I'm going to make the world a better place.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But he's one of your own! I refuse to believe you'd harm a fellow Nohrian.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Why should I listen to a traitor like you? You abandoned us! You have no right to tell me what to do!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo...please.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Ugh, fine! Keep this pitiful fool if you like him so much. Good-bye, Corrin. When the time is right, you'll pay for what you've done.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo, wait! It doesn't have to be this way...

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: I've never seen such a display of power.

end.speaker: Jakob
end.line: Yes... Lord Leo is a gifted dark mage. He's feared and respected in Nohr.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: He's certainly changed since the time I spent there. The Leo I remember was kind and curious. Even clumsy at times. I wonder what happened to him...

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: Woooo! You guys saved me! This calls for a feast. No, better idea—an all-night party! We'll wear pajamas and eat bonbons. Let's get started! Izana in the house!

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: Is...is this still Zola?

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: No...but I think we underestimated Zola's Izana impression.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Um, Archduke Izana, before we get to the bonbons, I have a few questions. Have you witnessed any nearby conflicts involving the Nohrians?

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: Oh, yeah. Definitely. What a bunch of party poopers they were. We were just listening to some music and getting massages. And then I heard, like, a big explosion or something outside. I went to see what was going on, and they captured me. I was still wearing my silk pj's! Anyway, we're all about love, peace, and chicken grease here in Izumo... So we don't exactly have a world-class military force. I don't know what happened after that. I was in my own jail. Luckily, I previously had the cell equipped with velvet sheets and scented candles. Best sleep I've had in weeks!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm so sorry you had to, uh, suffer through all that...

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Yes. It's despicable for Nohr to take advantage of a neutral realm like this. Archduke Izana, I know you've been confined to a luxuriously appointed cell... But would you happen to know anything about my brothers Ryoma and Takumi?

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: Well, I've heard of them! That's something, right? I did overhear that the battle stretched all the way to the Bottomless Canyon. Maybe they just fell in?

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: Gods! No!

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Get ahold of yourself, Sakura! Your brothers are not the type to accidentally fall into a canyon. We've got to believe that both of them are alive and healthy.

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: I'm sorry—that was rude of me to speculate like that. It's just that that canyon is totally treacherous! Such a hazard! Anyway, maybe I can help by reading your fortune.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm a bit skeptical of fortune-telling...but this is your kingdom...

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: Yep! And I'm a descendant of the gods! It really is a pretty sweet deal from me. All right, here we go...

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: Oh, ancient gods... What's up? I ask that you please answer me. ... Oh, I'm getting something! In the white light, a hand ♪ reaches through... A double edged blade cuts your ♪ heart in two... waking dreams fade away... ♪ Embrace the brand-new day...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Can it be?

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: Om...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Is that it?

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: Om...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hmm.

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: All right, I'm all done.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Oh. That's it?

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: I'm sorry, but that wasn't very helpful.

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: Hey, what can I tell you? I don't make the fortunes up—I just read 'em.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Very well. Let's just move on.

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: Sounds good to me. I'm dying for something bubbly to drink. Who wants to join me in the sauna? Oh, right. You probably want to hurry off and find your friends. Well, there's no rush. I peeked into their fortunes a little bit just now. And I can tell you that they're both doing OK at the moment.

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: Are you s-sure? I'd really like to believe that.

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: I swear it on my gold-plated statue of myself. They're fine.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Well. Thank you, Archduke Izana, for your hospitality and services as fortune-teller. It is tempting to stay and rest, but we'll leave now in search of our brothers.

end.speaker: Izana
end.line: I knew it. Oh well! Come back again sometime, and we'll have a toga party.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I don't know what that is, but...OK. Take care.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I can't stop thinking about the fortune Izana read for us... Those words were so poetic. "A double-edged blade..." "Embrace the brand-new day..."

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Corrin, I must speak with you.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Is everything OK?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes. Well, I don't know, actually... It's about that fortune.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It was strange, wasn't it? And a bit haunting, too...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes. Those were the words to a song my mother taught me as a child.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Are you certain? Do you remember the meaning behind the lyrics?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: No. It's an ancient song. But this is what troubles me. The lyrics almost seem to speak directly to YOU.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: To me? How is that possible?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I don't know. the song has always been a bit of a mystery... But I never thought about trying to solve it until now.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Perhaps it's just a coincidence. Right? I mean, how could someone write a song about me if I hadn't been born... Oh, um...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: *sob*

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Azura, what's the matter?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I'm sorry... Please forget about all of this.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: All right, I'll drop it for now. But don't hesitate to come speak with me about anything. At any time. I'm here for you.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Thank you, Corrin. All right, let's get going, shall we?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Azura?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What was she trying to tell me?
